item.description: Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1423; 08:03PM; 6234 N Agnes Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/33LSzas; #NorthHollywood; 21 Firefighters took just 15 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish an intense outside fire that extended into a debris-filled detached garage conversion at the east end of the property. Firefighters prevented all but exterior damage to the eaves of the 1,066 square-foot one-story primary residence, and halted flames before they could cause any damage to a neighboring home to the north. During the firefight, firefighters encountered an adult male resident with 2nd degree burns to his hands and legs. He was provided immediate on-scene care before being transported by LAFD Paramedics to an area hospital in serious condition. No other injuries reported. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E89 RA889 RA89 T60; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1423; 07:48PM; 6234 N Agnes Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/33LSzas; #NorthHollywood; PRELIM: Outside fire in the rear yard has extended into a one story home.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E102 E260 E89 RA889 RA89 T60; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Hiker Rescue; INC#0923; 02:18PM; Temescal Gateway Park; MAP: https://bit.ly/3KtgyMv; #PacificPalisades; LAFD ground and air response to an adult female hiker with a fractured ankle, south of Temescal Canyon Falls. LAFD ground crew is with patient, providing care and preparing her to be hoisted into a hovering LAFD rescue helicopter for continuing care during direct transport to an area hospital.; FS 69; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 E19 E269 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA69 RH114 T69; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Drowning - FATALITY; INC#0423; 08:11AM; 2032 W Wilshire Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Gz4HKm; Westlake; Firefighters located the body of a deceased (age/gender unknown at this time) person in MacArthur Park. Circumstances unknown and all questions are referred to LAPD Inc# 1010 for the investigation. No further details.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; E11 E211 RA11 T11; CH7; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1762; 10:10PM; 4228 N Bakman Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nseyKp; Studio City; KNOCKDOWN: Structure type is updated to a two story, single family dwelling. The fire was in the attic and extended down into the walls on one side of the building. Firefighters encountered zero visibility conditions on the 2nd floor while locating the fire. 29 firefighters extinguished the fire in 35 minutes with no injuries reported. Occupants on scene stated all were out of the building prior to LAFD arrival. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 86; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E227 E260 E278 E76 E86 RA86 T27 T60 T78; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1762; 09:35PM; 4228 N Bakman Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nseyKp; Studio City; One story, single family dwelling with smoke showing. Firefighters are in the offensive mode against an attic fire. One additional task force requested.; FS 86; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E260 E278 E86 T60 T78; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1630; 08:27PM; 1140 S Central Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3K7tG9P; Downtown; KNOCKDOWN: 34 firefighters extinguished both the truck and attic fire in 26 minutes with no injuries reported. No further details.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E10 E202 E209 E210 E9 RA209 RA9 SQ21 T10 T2 T9; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1630; 08:01PM; 1125 S Central Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3aoRzbE; Downtown; Box truck well involved in fire appears to have extended to the attic of the exposed two story, commercial building. Firefighters have almost extinguished the truck fire and are working to locate the potential attic fire and ensure there is no further extension into the rest of the building. ; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E10 E202 E209 E210 E9 RA209 RA9 SQ21 T10 T2 T9; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Tank Truck Fire; INC#0065; 02:14AM; 6500 N Canoga Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3qoV3Er; Canoga Park; A passenger vehicle collided into a tanker truck then careened into a fountain and erupted into flames. The occupant of the vehicle was determined deceased on scene (age/gender unknown). The tanker spilled an estimated 1,000 gallons of fuel. There are no other injuries reported. The tanker spill is a static situation (no fire involved). Firefighters have secured the area and are working contain any run off. There is a full road closure at Victory and Canoga and this area will remain closed for an indefinite time period as private contractors respond to remove the fuel / tanker truck. Any questions regarding the collision are referring to law enforcement, LAPD Inc# 0153. Original 9-1-1 call received at 1:00AM. No further details.; FS 72; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; AR1 BC17 E104 E287 E293 E305 E87 E93 RA105 RA87 RA872 SQ87 T105 T87 T93; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1891; 12:08AM; 15033 W Ventura Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FifjvL; Sherman Oaks; KNOCKDOWN: 75 firefighters extinguished the fire in one hour and 20 minutes with no injuries reported. Crews will remain on scene through the night for overhaul operations. Please avoid the area due to the heavy presence of fire apparatus and hose lines. No further details.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; AR1 BC10 BC14 BC5 BC9 CM42 E102 E108 E235 E239 E288 E289 E290 E83 E87 E89 E99 EA1 EM14 EM17 HE1 HR3 RA88 RA89 T35 T39 T88 T89 T90 UR88 UR89; CH9; 17 18; Margaret Stewart
